description: From Old French nacaire, nacre (cognate with Italian nacchera, mediaeval Latin nacara), from Arabic نَقَّارَة‎ (naqqāra, “drum”).

entries.meaning: (music) A small drum, of Arabic origin, and the forebear of the European kettledrum.
examples: the Norman trumpets from the battlements  […] , mingled with the deep and hollow clang of the nakers, (a species of kettle-drum,) retorted in notes of defiance the challenge of the enemy.
